lines.text:
[after Leeland removes his shirt to investigate a bug-bite]
Where'd you learn the strip act? In college?

[about sliding down a very big hill]
The first step's a bitch!

[singing]
Don't ever hit your mother with a shovel. It will leave a dull impression on her mind. Paul Newman said the same line in "Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid".
[first lines]
He's been over there a while. Ya think he's doing any good?
[shrugs]
I got payments to make on a Chevrolet. Goddamn scabs over there!
I lost myself a son, he comes back a daughter. We'd you get all that hair?
Neat work you guys do up here.
Well Leeland, all ya gotta do is find something else for mommy to wipe baby's little butt with, and all this nest work's outa business.
Why didn't you go hunting?
I don't know. I guess I'd want the fox to win.
[last lines]
That goddman family.
You know, Hank, I thought all of you dinosaurs were dead.
Well, if they want this one, they're gonna have to shoot 'em. Just like King Kong, yuh gotta knock 'em down.
People do what they want, kid. I don't tell 'em what to do.
Why don't you show us some of that university learnin'... say something to us in trigonometry. Go on! Say something to us in trigonom'.
[repeated lines]
Where did you get all that hair?
It grows.

[commenting on watching Leland wake up]
He looked just like Rita Hayworth!
Well, good luck.

[amazed at his apathy]
Good luck?
Well, yeah, Willard. Now, you have to admit, it's better than "best wishes" or "bon voyage," so take it how I'm givin' it to you. Good luck, Willard!
[repeated line]
I've got contracts to fill, eggs to hatch and cats to kill.
